basics.name: Vin Gahnk 1 (Khan Hekim 32)

bio.para: When khonnir quit the technic league and escaped with val, he escaped with your predecessor as well, who had been captured for experimentation (perhaps this could be the source of the magic your current form has, but i'll leave that up to you). After settling in torch, your predecessor began seeking out other androids held by the technic league, bit off a bit more than he could chew, and perished. Khonnir recovered your body and you've been lying dormant ever since. now, the current one awakens and inhabits his body.
-having predecessors who have observed dislike of handshakes, Vin greats strangers with a light bow, palms up
-phrases such as "may your predecessors honor you" and "may the great beyond accept you" are used as greetings and as invokations in combat

-apologizing for social ignorance is common because it flatters the recipient and prepares them for the surprise. often leads requests for information with "may I ask" or I "apologize for my ignorance."
-refers to self as "one" to differntiate self from predecessors

deity.name: Brigh
deity.domainlist: Artifice, Construct Subdomain, Earth, Fire, Knowledge, Metal Subdomain, Smoke Subdomain, Thought Subdomain
deity.source: Paizo Inc. - Inner Sea Gods, p.176
deity.title: The Whisper in the Bronze

basics.description: his appearence is stylized and precise. throught the lifetimes of his predecassors he has learned that he will be noticed among humans. while previous tennants tried to hide their differences, this iteration insists on accentuating the difference now that he and he previous predecessor are known individuals in torch and he wants to remain seperate.

hair.length: "Mousse the crap out of it" --Ryan Reynolds

value.para: fought through part of the initial dungeon and left for gear
returned parda gar body to town
Mylin is the cleric (possibly evil necromancer)
gant gained fast healing 5 from the numerian liquid
star spore dc 15 fort darkvision and invisible creatures
blood brush DC 14 fort per round wis dam and dazed
went to Dolga to get the tag translated --> says "pet"
talked to seph. she wants us to kill gremlins.
brown mold found killed by ray of cold
Gerrol's Bethrothed promised us masterwork org.gary.weapons
mylan says he's impressed with us returning bodies
he worships the fey Eldest Ng

skills.list_mods: Acrobatics +8, Appraise +7, Bluff +4, Climb +4, Craft (Tattoos) +8, Diplomacy +7, Disable Device +5, Escape Artist +8, Intimidate +4, Knowledge (Arcana) +8, Knowledge (Dungeoneering) +8, Knowledge (Engineering) +5, Knowledge (Geography) +5, Knowledge (History) +9, Knowledge (Nobility) +8, Knowledge (Religion) +5, Perception +10, Sense Motive +1, Spellcraft +10, Stealth +6, Swim +4, Use Magic Device +6

savebonus.description: +4 racial bonus on all saving throws against mind-affecting effects, paralysis, poison, and stun effects, are not subject to fatigue or exhaustion, and are immune to disease and sleep effects. Androids can never gain morale bonuses, and are immune to fear effects and all emotion-based effects.

combatbonus.description: +1 trait bonus on attack rolls against robots and a +1 dodge bonus to AC against attacks made by robots.

savebonus.description: +4 racial bonus on all saving throws against mind-affecting effects, paralysis, poison, and stun effects, are not subject to fatigue or exhaustion, and are immune to disease and sleep effects. Androids can never gain morale bonuses, and are immune to fear effects and all emotion-based effects.

checklist.name: Arcane Pool (Su)
checklist.description: You have a reservoir of mystical arcane energy that you draw upon to fuel your powers and enhance your weapon. This arcane pool has 6 points. The pool refreshes once per day when you prepare your spells. You can expend 1 point from your arcane pool as a swift action to grant any weapon you are holding a +1 enhancement bonus for 1 minute. These bonuses can be added to the weapon, stacking with existing weapon enhancement to a maximum of +5. Multiple uses of this ability do not stack with themselves.

item.name: +1 Rapier
item.type: MAGIC.WEAPON.RESIZABLE.MELEE.MARTIAL.ONEHANDED.FINESSEABLE.PIERCING.MELEEPIERCING.SWORD.BLADELIGHT.WEAPON GROUP BLADES LIGHT.WEAPON GROUP MELEE ONEHANDED PIERCING.CUSTOM.METAL.MASTERWORK.WEAPONENHANCEMENT.PLUS1

feat.name: Combat Casting
feat.description: You are adept at spellcasting when threatened or distracted.
feat.benefit: You get a +4 bonus on concentration checks made to cast a spell or use a spell-like ability when casting on the defensive or while grappled.

feat.name: Fencing Grace
feat.description: Your dashing style and fluid rapier forms allow you to use agility rather than brute force to fell your foes.
feat.benefit: When wielding a rapier one-handed, you can add your Dexterity modifier instead of your Strength modifier to that weapon's damage. The rapier must be one appropriate for your size. You do not gain this benefit while fighting with two org.gary.weapons or using flurry of blows, or anytime another hand is otherwise occupied. In addition, if you have the panache class feature, you gain a +2 bonus to your CMD against attempts to disarm you of your rapier while you have at least 1 panache point.

feat.name: Technologist
feat.description: You are familiar with the basic mechanics of technology.
feat.benefit: You are considered to be trained in any skill used against a technology-based subject. If the skill in question requires training to use even against non-technological subjects, you must still have ranks in that skill in order to gain the benefit ofTechnologist. Normal: You treat all skill checks made against technology as if they were untrained skill checks. This may mean that you cannot attempt certain skill checks, even if you possess ranks in the skill in question.

feat.name: Weapon Focus (Rapier)
feat.description: You are especially good at using your chosen weapon.
feat.benefit: You gain a +1 bonus on all attack rolls you make using the selected weapon.

archetype.name: Inspired Blade
archetype.description: An inspired blade is both a force of org.gary.personality and a sage of swordplay dedicated to the perfection of combat with the rapier. They use the science and geometry with swordplay to beautiful and deadly effect.
archetype.source: Paizo Inc. - Advanced Class Guide, p.125

special_quality.name: +2 Dexterity, +2 Intelligence, -2 Charisma
special_quality.description: Androids have swift reflexes and are very intelligent, but have difficulty relating to others.
special_quality.source: Paizo Publishing - Inner Sea Bestiary, p.6

special_quality.name: Arcane Accuracy (Su)
special_quality.description: You can expend 1 point from your arcane pool as a swift action to grant yourself a +4 insight bonus on all attack rolls until the end of your turn.
special_quality.source: Paizo Inc. - Ultimate Magic, p.11

special_quality.name: Arcane Pool (Su)
special_quality.description: You have a reservoir of mystical arcane energy that you draw upon to fuel your powers and enhance your weapon. This arcane pool has 6 points. The pool refreshes once per day when you prepare your spells. You can expend 1 point from your arcane pool as a swift action to grant any weapon you are holding a +1 enhancement bonus for 1 minute. These bonuses can be added to the weapon, stacking with existing weapon enhancement to a maximum of +5. Multiple uses of this ability do not stack with themselves.
special_quality.aspect: Ability Benefit: (6/day), CheckCount: 6, CheckType: Uses per Day
special_quality.source: Paizo Inc. - Ultimate Magic, p.9

special_quality.name: Armor Proficiency (Ex)
special_quality.description: You can cast magus spells while wearing light org.gary.armor without incurring the normal arcane spell failure chance. Like any other arcane spellcaster, a magus wearing medium org.gary.armor, heavy org.gary.armor, or a shield incurs a chance of arcane spell failure if the spell in question has a somatic component. A multiclass magus still incurs the normal arcane spell failure chance for arcane spells received from other classes.
special_quality.source: Paizo Inc. - Ultimate Magic

special_quality.name: Cantrips
special_quality.description: You can prepare a number of cantrips, or 0-level spells, each day. These spells are cast like any other spell, but they are not expended when cast and may be used again.
special_quality.source: Paizo Inc. - Ultimate Magic, p.10

special_quality.name: Deeds
special_quality.description: Swashbucklers spend panache points to accomplish deeds. Most deeds grant the swashbuckler a momentary bonus or effect, but some provide longer-lasting effects. Some deeds remain in effect while the swashbuckler has at least 1 panache point, but do not require expending panache to be maintained. A swashbuckler can only perform deeds of her level or lower. Unless otherwise noted, a deed can be performed multiple successive times, as long as the swashbuckler has or spends the required number of panache points to perform the deed.
special_quality.source: Paizo Inc. - Advanced Class Guide, p.56

special_quality.name: Derring-Do (Ex)
special_quality.description: At 1st level, a swashbuckler can spend 1 panache point when she makes an Acrobatics, Climb, Escape Artist, Fly, Ride, or Swim check to roll 1d6 and add the result to the check. She can do this after she makes the check but before the result is revealed. If the result of the d6 roll is a natural 6, she rolls another 1d6 and adds it to the check. She can continue to do this as long as she rolls natural 6s, up to 4 times.
special_quality.source: Paizo Inc. - Advanced Class Guide, p.56

special_quality.name: Dodging Panache (Ex)
special_quality.description: At 1st level, when an opponent attempts a melee attack against the swashbuckler, the swashbuckler can as an immediate action spend 1 panache point to move 5 feet; doing so grants the swashbuckler a dodge bonus to AC equal to her Charisma modifier (minimum 0) against the triggering attack. This movement doesn't negate the attack, which is still resolved as if the swashbuckler had not moved from the original square. This movement is not a 5-foot step; it provokes attacks of opportunity from creatures other than the one who triggered this deed. The swashbuckler can only perform this deed while wearing light or no org.gary.armor, and while carrying no heavier than a light load. This deed's cost cannot be reduced by any ability or effect that reduces the number of panache points a deed costs.
special_quality.source: Paizo Inc. - Advanced Class Guide, p.56

special_quality.name: Opportune Parry and Riposte (Ex)
special_quality.description: At 1st level, when an opponent makes a melee attack against the swashbuckler, she can spend 1 panache point and expend a use of an attack of opportunity to attempt to parry that attack. The swashbuckler makes an attack roll as if she were making an attack of opportunity; for each size category the attacking creature is larger than the swashbuckler, the swashbuckler takes a -2 penalty on this roll. If her result is greater than the attacking creature's result, the creature's attack automatically misses. The swashbuckler must declare the use of this ability after the creature's attack is announced, but before its attack roll is made. Upon performing a successful parry and if she has at least 1 panache point, the swashbuckler can as an immediate action make an attack against the creature whose attack she parried, provided that creature is within her reach. This deed's cost cannot be reduced by any ability or effect that reduces the number of panache points a deed costs.
special_quality.source: Paizo Inc. - Advanced Class Guide, p.56

special_quality.name: Constructed
special_quality.description: For the purposes of effects targeting creatures by type (such as a ranger's favored enemy and bane org.gary.weapons), androids count as both humanoids and constructs. Androids gain a +4 racial bonus on all saving throws against mind-affecting effects, paralysis, poison, and stun effects, are not subject to fatigue or exhaustion, and are immune to disease and sleep effects. Androids can never gain morale bonuses, and are immune to fear effects and all emotion-based effects.
special_quality.aspect: SaveBonus: +4 racial bonus on all saving throws against mind-affecting effects, paralysis, poison, and stun effects, are not subject to fatigue or exhaustion, and are immune to disease and sleep effects. Androids can never gain morale bonuses, and are immune to fear effects and all emotion-based effects.
special_quality.source: Paizo Publishing - Inner Sea Bestiary, p.6

special_quality.name: Darkvision (Ex)
special_quality.description: Range 60 ft.; Darkvision is the extraordinary ability to see with no light source at all, out to a range specified for the creature. Darkvision is black and white only (colors cannot be discerned). It does not allow characters to see anything that they could not see otherwise-invisible objects are still invisible, and illusions are still visible as what they seem to be. Likewise, darkvision subjects a creature to gaze attacks normally. The presence of light does not spoil darkvision.
special_quality.source: Paizo Inc. - Bestiary

special_quality.name: Emotionless
special_quality.description: Androids have problems processing emotions properly, and thus take a -4 penalty on Sense Motive checks.
special_quality.source: Paizo Publishing - Inner Sea Bestiary, p.6

special_quality.name: Exceptional Senses
special_quality.description: Androids have darkvision to a range of 60 feet and low-light vision. They also gain a +2 racial bonus on Perception checks.
special_quality.source: Paizo Publishing - Inner Sea Bestiary, p.6

special_quality.name: Inspired Finesse (Ex)
special_quality.description: An inspired blade gains the benefits of Weapon Finesse with the rapier (this ability counts as having the Weapon Finesse feat for the purpose of meeting feat prerequisites) and gains Weapon Focus (rapier) as a bonus feat.
special_quality.source: Paizo Inc. - Advanced Class Guide, p.125

special_quality.name: Inspired Panache (Ex)
special_quality.description: Each day, an inspired blade gains 5 panache points. Unlike other swashbucklers, an inspired blade gains no panache from a killing blow. She gains panache only from scoring a critical hit with a rapier. This ability alters the panache class feature.
special_quality.source: Paizo Inc. - Advanced Class Guide, p.125

special_quality.name: Languages
special_quality.description: Androids begin play speaking Common. Androids with high Intelligence can choose any languages they want (except secret languages, such as Druidic).
special_quality.source: Paizo Publishing - Inner Sea Bestiary, p.6

special_quality.name: Low-Light Vision (Ex)
special_quality.description: You can see x2 as far as humans in low illumination. Characters with low-light vision have eyes that are so sensitive to light that they can see twice as far as normal in dim light. Low-Light Vision is color vision. A spellcaster with low-light vision can read a scroll as long as even the tiniest candle flame is next to her as a source of light. Characters with low-light vision can see outdoors on a moonlit night as well as they can during the day.
special_quality.source: Paizo Inc. - Bestiary

special_quality.name: Nanite Surge 1/day
special_quality.description: An android's body is infused with nanites. Once per day as an immediate action, an android can cause her nanites to surge, granting a bonus equal to 3 + the android's character level on any one d20 roll; this ability must be activated before the roll is made. When an android uses this power, her circuitry-tattoos glow with light equivalent to that of a torch in illumination for 1 round.
special_quality.source: Paizo Publishing - Inner Sea Bestiary, p.6

special_quality.name: Spell Recall (Su)
special_quality.description: You can use your arcane pool to recall spells he has already cast. With a swift action, you can recall any single magus spell that you have already prepared and cast that day by expending a number of points from your arcane pool equal to the spell's level (minimum 1). The spell is prepared again, just as if it had not been cast.
special_quality.source: Paizo Inc. - Ultimate Magic, p.12

special_quality.name: Weapon and Armor Proficiency
special_quality.description: Swashbucklers are proficient with simple and martial org.gary.weapons, as well as light org.gary.armor and bucklers.
special_quality.source: Paizo Inc. - Advanced Class Guide

special_attack.name: Spell Combat (Ex)
special_attack.description: You can cast spells and wield your org.gary.weapons at the same time. This functions much like two-weapon fighting, but the offhand weapon is a spell that is being cast. To use this ability, you must have one hand free (even if the spell being cast does not have somatic components), while wielding a light or one-handed melee weapon in the other hand. As a full-round action, you can make all of your attacks with your melee weapon at a -2 penalty and can also cast any spell from the magus spell list with a casting time of 1 standard action (any attack roll made as part of this spell also takes this penalty). If you cast this spell defensively, you can decide to take an additional penalty on your attack rolls, up to your Intelligence bonus, and add the same amount as a circumstance bonus on your concentration check. If the check fails, the spell is wasted, but the attacks still take the penalty. You can choose to cast the spell first or make the weapon attacks first, but if you have more than one attack, you cannot cast the spell between weapon attacks.

special_attack.name: Spellstrike (Ex)
special_attack.description: Whenever you cast a spell with a range of "touch" from the magus spell list, you can deliver the spell through any weapon you are wielding as part of a melee attack. Instead of the free melee touch attack normally allowed to deliver the spell, a magus can make one free melee attack with his weapon (at his highest base attack bonus) as part of casting this spell. If successful, this melee attack deals its normal damage as well as the effects of the spell. If you make this attack in concert with spell combat, this melee attack takes all the penalties accrued by spell combat melee attacks. This attack uses the weapon's critical range (20, 19-20, or 18-20 and modified by the keen weapon property or similar effects), but the spell effect only deals x2 damage on a successful critical hit, while the weapon damage uses its own critical modifier.

trait.name: Magical Lineage (Shocking Grasp)
trait.description: One of your parents was a gifted spellcaster who not only used metamagic often, but developed many magical org.gary.items and perhaps even a new spell or two--and you have inherited a fragment of this greatness. When you apply metamagic feats to Shocking Grasp, treat its actual level as 1 lower for determining the spell's final adjusted level.
trait.source: Paizo Inc. - Advanced Player's Guide, p.329

trait.name: Robot Slayer
trait.description: The strange automatons that plague the wilds of Numeria are a blight upon the world, and the idea that there could be countless more of these creatures lying in wait in the unknown ruins scattered throughout the region chills your blood. Khonnir's recovery of a deactivated robot from the caves below Torch worries you-not only could that thing wake up and run amok in town, but there may well be more lurking below! You want to explore the caves under Torch to determine if there is indeed a lurking robot threat below town. You gain a +1 trait bonus on attack rolls against robots and a +1 dodge bonus to AC against attacks made by robots.
trait.source: Paizo Publishing - Iron Gods Player's Guide, p.9

trait.name: Scholar of the Great Beyond (Knowledge (History))
trait.description: Your greatest interests as a child did not lie with current events or the mundane- you have always felt out of place, as if you were born in the wrong era. You take to philosophical discussions of the Great Beyond and of historical events with ease. You gain a +1 trait bonus on Knowledge (history) and Knowledge (planes) checks, and one of these skills (your choice) is always a class skill for you.

character.weapon_proficiencies: Aldori Dueling Sword, Amentum, Ankus, Atlatl, Boarding Axe, Throwing Axe, Bardiche, Battle Aspergillum, Battleaxe, Bayonet, Bec de Corbin, Bill, Blade Boot, Blowgun, Boar Spear, Boarding Pike, Brass Knife, Brass Knuckles, Nine Ring Broadsword, Butterfly Sword, Cat-O'-Nine-Tails, Cestus, Chakram, Club, Combat Scabbard, Heavy Crossbow, Light Crossbow, Cutlass, Dagger, Chain Dagger, Punching Dagger, Dart, Dogslicer, Double Chicken Saber, Earth Breaker, Estoc, Falchion, Light Flail, Heavy Flail, Gaff, Gandasa, Gauntlet, Spiked Gauntlet, Gladius, Glaive, Glaive-Guisarme, Grapple, Greataxe, Greatclub, Greatsword, Guisarme, Hair, Halberd, Light Hammer, Hanbo, Handaxe, Hook Hand, Hooked Lance, Horsechopper, Hunga Munga, Hurlbat, Iron Brush, Javelin, Jutte, Katana, Kerambit, Klar, Kukri, Kumade, Kunai, Lance, Laser Torch, Longbow, Longspear, Longsword, Lucerne Hammer, Lungchuan Tamo, Heavy Mace, Light Mace, Machete, Manople, Mattock, Mere Club, Monk's Spade, Morningstar, Naginata, Nodachi, Ogre Hook, Heavy Pick, Light Pick, Pilum, Planson, Poisoned Sand Tube, Quarterstaff, Ranseur, Rapier, Rhomphaia, Rock, Sansetsukon, Sap, Scimitar, Scizore, Scythe, Sea-Knife, Shang Gou, Shieldbash, Shortbow, Shortspear, Sibat, Sickle, Sling, Spear, Boar Spear, Spear-Sling, Ray Spells, Touch Spells, Spiked Armor, Splash Weapon, Stake, Starknife, Stingchuck, Stonebow, Switchblade Knife, Bastard Sword, Short Sword, Tri-Point Double-Edged Sword, Sword Cane, Syringe spear, Tepoztopilli, Terbutje, Great Terbutje, Throwing Arrow Cord, Tiger Fork, Tonfa, Trident, Tube Arrow Shooter, Unarmed Strike, Underwater Heavy Crossbow, Underwater Light Crossbow, War Razor, Dwarven Waraxe, Warhammer, Weighted Spear, Wushu Dart

spell.name: Acid Splash
spell.effect: You fire a small orb of acid at the target dealing 1d3 points of acid damage.
spell.description: You fire a small orb of acid at the target dealing 1d3 points of acid damage.

spell.name: Arcane Mark
spell.effect: This spell allows you to inscribe your personal rune or mark.
spell.target: One personal rune or mark, all of which must fit within 1 sq. ft.
spell.description: This spell allows you to inscribe your personal rune or mark.

spell.name: Dancing Lights
spell.effect: You create up to four lights that resemble lanterns or torches.
spell.target: Up to four lights, all within a 10-ft.-radius area
spell.description: You create up to four lights that resemble lanterns or torches.

spell.name: Daze
spell.effect: This spell clouds the mind of a humanoid creature with 4 or fewer Hit Dice so that it takes no actions.
spell.target: One humanoid creature of 4 HD or less
spell.description: This spell clouds the mind of a humanoid creature with 4 or fewer Hit Dice so that it takes no actions.

spell.name: Detect Magic
spell.effect: You detect magical auras.
spell.description: You detect magical auras.

spell.name: Disrupt Undead
spell.effect: You direct a ray of positive energy dealing 1d6 points of damage to Undead.
spell.description: You direct a ray of positive energy dealing 1d6 points of damage to Undead.

spell.name: Flare
spell.effect: This cantrip creates a burst of light.
spell.description: This cantrip creates a burst of light.

spell.name: Ghost Sound
spell.effect: Ghost sound allows you to create a volume of sound that rises, recedes, approaches, or remains at a fixed place.
spell.description: Ghost sound allows you to create a volume of sound that rises, recedes, approaches, or remains at a fixed place.

spell.name: Light
spell.effect: This spell causes a touched object to glow like a torch.
spell.description: This spell causes a touched object to glow like a torch.

spell.name: Mage Hand
spell.effect: You point your finger at an object and can lift it and move it at will from a distance.
spell.target: One nonmagical, unattended object weighing up to 5 lbs.
spell.description: You point your finger at an object and can lift it and move it at will from a distance.

spell.name: Open/Close
spell.effect: You can open or close [your choice] a door, chest, box, window, bag, pouch, bottle, barrel, or other container.
spell.target: Object weighing up to 30 lbs. or portal that can be opened or closed
spell.description: You can open or close (your choice) a door, chest, box, window, bag, pouch, bottle, barrel, or other container.

spell.name: Prestidigitation
spell.effect: Prestidigitations are minor tricks that novice spellcasters use for practice.
spell.description: Prestidigitations are minor tricks that novice spellcasters use for practice.

spell.name: Ray of Frost
spell.effect: A ray of freezing air and ice projects from your pointing finger dealing 1d3 points of cold damage.
spell.description: A ray of freezing air and ice projects from your pointing finger dealing 1d3 points of cold damage.

spell.name: Read Magic
spell.effect: You can decipher magical inscriptions on objects--books, scrolls, org.gary.weapons, and the like--that would otherwise be unintelligible.
spell.description: You can decipher magical inscriptions on objects--books, scrolls, org.gary.weapons, and the like--that would otherwise be unintelligible.

spell.name: Spark
spell.effect: Ignites flammable objects.

source.source: Paizo Inc. - Advanced Player's Guide, p.246

spell.description: Ignites flammable objects.

spell.name: Blade Lash
spell.effect: Use your weapon like a whip to trip an opponent.

source.source: Paizo Inc. - Advanced Class Guide, p.175

spell.description: Use your weapon like a whip to trip an opponent.

spell.name: Burning Hands
spell.effect: A cone of searing flame shoots from your fingertips dealing 4d4 points of fire damage to any creature in the effect area.
spell.description: A cone of searing flame shoots from your fingertips dealing (min(5,CASTERLEVEL))d4 points of fire damage to any creature in the effect area.

spell.name: Chill Touch
spell.effect: A touch from your hand, which glows with blue energy, disrupts the life force of living creatures dealing 1d6 points of damage.
spell.saveinfo: Fortitude partial or Will negates; see text
spell.description: A touch from your hand, which glows with blue energy, disrupts the life force of living creatures dealing 1d6 points of damage.

spell.name: Color Spray
spell.effect: A vivid cone of clashing colors springs forth from your hand, causing creatures to become stunned, perhaps also blinded, and possibly knocking them unconscious.
spell.description: A vivid cone of clashing colors springs forth from your hand, causing creatures to become stunned, perhaps also blinded, and possibly knocking them unconscious.

spell.name: Enlarge Person
spell.effect: This spell causes instant growth of a humanoid creature, doubling its height and multiplying its weight by 8.
spell.description: This spell causes instant growth of a humanoid creature, doubling its height and multiplying its weight by 8.

spell.name: Frostbite
spell.effect: Target takes 1d6+4 nonlethal cold damage and is fatigued.
spell.description: Target takes 1d6+(CASTERLEVEL) nonlethal cold damage and is fatigued.

spell.name: Jump
spell.effect: The subject gets a +10 enhancement bonus on Acrobatics checks made to attempt high jumps or long jumps.
spell.description: The subject gets a +10 enhancement bonus on Acrobatics checks made to attempt high jumps or long jumps.

spell.name: Jury-Rig
spell.effect: Removes the broken condition from the targeted object.
spell.target: one broken object of up to 8 lbs.
spell.description: Removes the broken condition from the targeted object.

spell.name: Mirror Strike
spell.effect: You may strike multiple opponents with a single attack.
spell.description: You may strike multiple opponents with a single attack.

spell.name: Reduce Person
spell.effect: This spell causes instant diminution of a humanoid creature, halving its height, length, and width and dividing its weight by 8.
spell.description: This spell causes instant diminution of a humanoid creature, halving its height, length, and width and dividing its weight by 8.

spell.name: Shield
spell.effect: Shield creates an invisible shield of force that hovers in front of you.
spell.description: Shield creates an invisible shield of force that hovers in front of you.

spell.name: Shocking Grasp
spell.effect: Your successful melee touch attack deals 4d6 points of electricity damage.
spell.description: Your successful melee touch attack deals (min(5,CASTERLEVEL))d6 points of electricity damage.

spell.name: Snowball
spell.effect: You conjure a ball of packed ice and snow that you can throw at a single target as a ranged touch attack. The snowball deals 4d6 points of cold damage on a successful hit, and the target must make a successful Fortitude saving throw or be staggered for 1 round.
spell.target: One ball of ice and snow

source.source: Paizo Inc. - Pathfinder Player Companion: People of the North, p.26

spell.description: You conjure a ball of packed ice and snow that you can throw at a single target as a ranged touch attack. The snowball deals (min(5,CASTERLEVEL))d6 points of cold damage on a successful hit, and the target must make a successful Fortitude saving throw or be staggered for 1 round.

spell.name: True Strike
spell.effect: You gain temporary, intuitive insight into the immediate future during your next attack.
spell.description: You gain temporary, intuitive insight into the immediate future during your next attack.

spell.name: Acid Arrow
spell.effect: An arrow of acid springs from your hand and speeds to its target dealing 2d4 points of acid damage.
spell.description: An arrow of acid springs from your hand and speeds to its target dealing 2d4 points of acid damage.

spell.name: Bull's Strength
spell.effect: The subject becomes stronger granting a +4 enhancement bonus to Strength.
spell.description: The subject becomes stronger granting a +4 enhancement bonus to Strength.

spell.name: Cat's Grace
spell.effect: The transmuted creature becomes more graceful, agile, and coordinated granting a +4 enhancement bonus to Dexterity.
spell.description: The transmuted creature becomes more graceful, agile, and coordinated granting a +4 enhancement bonus to Dexterity.

spell.name: Defensive Shock
spell.effect: Electricity damages your attackers.
spell.description: Electricity damages your attackers.

spell.name: Invisibility
spell.effect: The creature or object touched becomes invisible.
spell.target: You or a creature or object weighing no more than 400 lbs.
spell.saveinfo: Will negates (harmless) or Will negates (harmless, object)
spell.description: The creature or object touched becomes invisible.

spell.name: Scorching Ray
spell.effect: You blast your enemies with up to 1 searing beams of fire dealing 4d6 points of fire damage.
spell.description: You blast your enemies with up to (min(3,1+(floor((CASTERLEVEL-3)/4)))) searing beams of fire dealing 4d6 points of fire damage.

spell.name: Acid Splash
spell.effect: You fire a small orb of acid at the target dealing 1d3 points of acid damage.
spell.description: You fire a small orb of acid at the target dealing 1d3 points of acid damage.

spell.name: Arcane Mark
spell.effect: This spell allows you to inscribe your personal rune or mark.
spell.target: One personal rune or mark, all of which must fit within 1 sq. ft.
spell.description: This spell allows you to inscribe your personal rune or mark.

spell.name: Dancing Lights
spell.effect: You create up to four lights that resemble lanterns or torches.
spell.target: Up to four lights, all within a 10-ft.-radius area
spell.description: You create up to four lights that resemble lanterns or torches.

spell.name: Daze
spell.effect: This spell clouds the mind of a humanoid creature with 4 or fewer Hit Dice so that it takes no actions.
spell.target: One humanoid creature of 4 HD or less
spell.description: This spell clouds the mind of a humanoid creature with 4 or fewer Hit Dice so that it takes no actions.

spell.name: Detect Magic
spell.effect: You detect magical auras.
spell.description: You detect magical auras.

spell.name: Disrupt Undead
spell.effect: You direct a ray of positive energy dealing 1d6 points of damage to Undead.
spell.description: You direct a ray of positive energy dealing 1d6 points of damage to Undead.

spell.name: Flare
spell.effect: This cantrip creates a burst of light.
spell.description: This cantrip creates a burst of light.

spell.name: Ghost Sound
spell.effect: Ghost sound allows you to create a volume of sound that rises, recedes, approaches, or remains at a fixed place.
spell.description: Ghost sound allows you to create a volume of sound that rises, recedes, approaches, or remains at a fixed place.

spell.name: Light
spell.effect: This spell causes a touched object to glow like a torch.
spell.description: This spell causes a touched object to glow like a torch.

spell.name: Mage Hand
spell.effect: You point your finger at an object and can lift it and move it at will from a distance.
spell.target: One nonmagical, unattended object weighing up to 5 lbs.
spell.description: You point your finger at an object and can lift it and move it at will from a distance.

spell.name: Open/Close
spell.effect: You can open or close [your choice] a door, chest, box, window, bag, pouch, bottle, barrel, or other container.
spell.target: Object weighing up to 30 lbs. or portal that can be opened or closed
spell.description: You can open or close (your choice) a door, chest, box, window, bag, pouch, bottle, barrel, or other container.

spell.name: Prestidigitation
spell.effect: Prestidigitations are minor tricks that novice spellcasters use for practice.
spell.description: Prestidigitations are minor tricks that novice spellcasters use for practice.

spell.name: Ray of Frost
spell.effect: A ray of freezing air and ice projects from your pointing finger dealing 1d3 points of cold damage.
spell.description: A ray of freezing air and ice projects from your pointing finger dealing 1d3 points of cold damage.

spell.name: Read Magic
spell.effect: You can decipher magical inscriptions on objects--books, scrolls, org.gary.weapons, and the like--that would otherwise be unintelligible.
spell.description: You can decipher magical inscriptions on objects--books, scrolls, org.gary.weapons, and the like--that would otherwise be unintelligible.

spell.name: Spark
spell.effect: Ignites flammable objects.

source.source: Paizo Inc. - Advanced Player's Guide, p.246

spell.description: Ignites flammable objects.

spell.name: Blade Lash
spell.effect: Use your weapon like a whip to trip an opponent.

source.source: Paizo Inc. - Advanced Class Guide, p.175

spell.description: Use your weapon like a whip to trip an opponent.

spell.name: Burning Hands
spell.effect: A cone of searing flame shoots from your fingertips dealing 4d4 points of fire damage to any creature in the effect area.
spell.description: A cone of searing flame shoots from your fingertips dealing (min(5,CASTERLEVEL))d4 points of fire damage to any creature in the effect area.

spell.name: Chill Touch
spell.effect: A touch from your hand, which glows with blue energy, disrupts the life force of living creatures dealing 1d6 points of damage.
spell.saveinfo: Fortitude partial or Will negates; see text
spell.description: A touch from your hand, which glows with blue energy, disrupts the life force of living creatures dealing 1d6 points of damage.

spell.name: Color Spray
spell.effect: A vivid cone of clashing colors springs forth from your hand, causing creatures to become stunned, perhaps also blinded, and possibly knocking them unconscious.
spell.description: A vivid cone of clashing colors springs forth from your hand, causing creatures to become stunned, perhaps also blinded, and possibly knocking them unconscious.

spell.name: Enlarge Person
spell.effect: This spell causes instant growth of a humanoid creature, doubling its height and multiplying its weight by 8.
spell.description: This spell causes instant growth of a humanoid creature, doubling its height and multiplying its weight by 8.

spell.name: Frostbite
spell.effect: Target takes 1d6+4 nonlethal cold damage and is fatigued.
spell.description: Target takes 1d6+(CASTERLEVEL) nonlethal cold damage and is fatigued.

spell.name: Jump
spell.effect: The subject gets a +10 enhancement bonus on Acrobatics checks made to attempt high jumps or long jumps.
spell.description: The subject gets a +10 enhancement bonus on Acrobatics checks made to attempt high jumps or long jumps.

spell.name: Jury-Rig
spell.effect: Removes the broken condition from the targeted object.
spell.target: one broken object of up to 8 lbs.
spell.description: Removes the broken condition from the targeted object.

spell.name: Mirror Strike
spell.effect: You may strike multiple opponents with a single attack.
spell.description: You may strike multiple opponents with a single attack.

spell.name: Reduce Person
spell.effect: This spell causes instant diminution of a humanoid creature, halving its height, length, and width and dividing its weight by 8.
spell.description: This spell causes instant diminution of a humanoid creature, halving its height, length, and width and dividing its weight by 8.

spell.name: Shield
spell.effect: Shield creates an invisible shield of force that hovers in front of you.
spell.description: Shield creates an invisible shield of force that hovers in front of you.

spell.name: Shocking Grasp
spell.effect: Your successful melee touch attack deals 4d6 points of electricity damage.
spell.description: Your successful melee touch attack deals (min(5,CASTERLEVEL))d6 points of electricity damage.

spell.name: Snowball
spell.effect: You conjure a ball of packed ice and snow that you can throw at a single target as a ranged touch attack. The snowball deals 4d6 points of cold damage on a successful hit, and the target must make a successful Fortitude saving throw or be staggered for 1 round.
spell.target: One ball of ice and snow
